title: Ticket #5815: Fix Python/Globus macro clash on Debian 7
description: On Debian 7, the Python header file pyconfig.h defines the macro HAVE_IO_H. In the Globus header file globus_common_include.h, this macro indicates that the Windows-only header file <io.h> is present and should be included. No other code references this macro. So we can undefine it after including the Python header files.
remarks:
2016-Aug-16 10:48:50 by tlmiller:
Code Review

Explanation: the (new) python_bindings_common.h reordered the includes. Undefining the spurious HAVE_IO_H from Debian 7's pyconfig.h is still necessary, but including pyconfig.h through boost takes care of undefining the _XOPEN_SOURCE and _POSIX_C_SOURCE macros for us (as well as making sure that Python won't be linked in its debug mode).

Change approved.
